intro: Thalictrum petaloideum var. stamineum, commonly known as the stamen thalictrum, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. It features delicate, fern-like leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers with prominent stamens that resemble petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial shade. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variety is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in woodland settings.
